storyInfo: The lonely journey finally reaches a turning point. As the golden ship appears in front of the Hunters, a mysterious enemy lying dormant in the ship also responds.

attributes.content: Breogan... was the owner of that key.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: During Iberia's Golden Age, he became a guest of honor to the aristocrats and nobility. He was once seen as the symbol of the budding harmony between the Ægir Islanders and Iberians.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Nobody knows what he was doing right before the disaster, or what he lacked the time to do. But he had already left behind a significant legacy. And for you, significant directions.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Regardless, he is part of the past. I have no doubt you will be the ones to make the choice, here in the present.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: As for the key... The question of why Breogan's key was left in Kazimierz is one we do not need answered.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But it was found by the Hunter, Skadi. This was no coincidence, but rather an inevitability. You all have a natural sensitivity towards the sea.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Indeed, I handed the key to that band. You will learn what they truly are. Perhaps the Ægir will need to enlist their help.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They are also searching for answers. Most of them are young, uncomfortable with the ocean's changes. After all, they cannot truly leave the place of their birth.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes... I hope we'll succeed. Humanity faces too many problems, and the layers upon layers of disasters can easily extinguish the light of our current civilization.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Gladiia, if you wish to act alone, I won't try to dissuade you. Skadi is just like you. Perhaps all the Hunters are.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But whatever you do, don't think you can solve all of this land's problems by yourself.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hm? Ask away. I will answer any of your questions.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ishar-mla...?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Where did you hear that name?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We're almost there.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But the ocean is just too vast. Even slight inaccuracies in the coordinates can lead to huge errors.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...It is also much calmer than I imagined.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: More than calm. Since leaving the lighthouse, we've actually faced fewer and fewer attacks.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Not even the wind or waves are stirring.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What does it mean?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: It means—
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Are you nervous, my poor little bird?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Eek! Wh-When did you— Stand where I can see you!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Who are you calling nervous, anyway? It's just... very, very few people manage to make it this far out into the ocean, so I... I can't be sure that—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Nay, your eyes are drawn back to over your shoulder, not to the horizon. You fear loss, more than the unknown.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Your superior gave you this chance so you could board the Stultifera and to reach out to the Ægir, not for you to wallow indecisively.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...I know that.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Before the fight comes to us, you must— Hey. Do you smell that, Shark?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Of course. Keep this cozy little boat slightly to the right, and soon we'll be able to see the bigger boat.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: It's long since become yet another nest though. Do we really intend to dive right in?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Do you need to rest, Specter?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Me? Is there something wrong with me? Why would you ask that?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Your hand is shaking.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Specter looks down at her hand. The one not wielding a weapon is indeed trembling slightly in the sea breeze.
Her consciousness gradually clears up and plunges deep into the abyss, untouchable.
I... Ah, is this anxiety? Or... excitement?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: But why?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Gladiia reaches out and gently holds Specter's hand, with Skadi following suit. The three Abyssal Hunters share a moment of silence.
Welcome home, Hunters.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Gladiia solemnly steps onto the ship's bow.
The sea breeze cleaves a path through the night, carrying upon it a familiar scent.
The quiet vessel sleeps soundly atop the ocean. It is a vassal of the sea breeze, the guest of an era.
Idealism was ubiquitous in that era, and it reflected the peoples' spirit of exploration—as well as their arrogance.
Skadi and Gladiia gaze wordlessly at the ship.
In an instant, they are inundated with a flood of thoughts. But in the end, they are invariably dragged back to the past—their youth, their home, the rhythmic swaying of the ship.
Only Specter continues to grip tightly onto the weapon in her hand, the sea breeze picking up slightly.
This breeze will carry the Hunters home.
(Slithers across a rocky surface)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Mon3tr, burn them.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Screeches)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Lord Carmen, we can't afford to stay here much longer. The team of Hunters is in danger.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Penal Battalion is being held back. It seems even I have underestimated the extent of the Church of the Deep's taint.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We should've cleared a temporary forward base at Gran Faro, to continue the pursuit.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We didn't have a choice.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If we have no way of securing the town, we'll be under attack from both sides.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: An Iberian Tercio consists of at least ten companies, approximately three thousand people. The officers of the Penal Battalion are more than sufficient to lead them to victory.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You seem quite knowledgeable about this.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: We've crossed paths more than once.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Are you suggesting we let the Penal Battalion handle Gran Faro, and head straight to the Eye of Iberia?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I wouldn't be opposed to that proposal, were we dealing with Victoria's fleet.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Otherwise, our losses will be even greater.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Riffs)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Miss Frost? Why are you—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A warm-up workout, she said.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: We come from the sea. We are the sea.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: However... (Riffs dejectedly)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: ...If you're willing to help, that would be ideal. What can you offer?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I can make them listen. Listen to my song.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: And your companions?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Apologies in advance, but Dan wants to borrow that chapel. The others are in there thinking up new songs.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Music? Your melodies are considerably different from what I used to hear in Leithanien. Are you sure they'll be interested in this sort of thing?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: (Riffs tersely)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: The meaning of life... is music.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: I just want to clean up the venue before the show starts.
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: Frost slowly pulls out her guitar.
Carmen cannot help but be surprised. He can tell that the organism in front of him is truly, genuinely thinking about 'music.' Her words contained no superfluous intentions.

It is by no means a metaphor. Use the word as such, and Frost's attention will quickly wander. She only thinks about music. Only this form of art, capable of stimulating her soul, can hold her attention.
(Flinching slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: (Riffs experimentally)
attributes.name: Frost

attributes.content: The lurking Sea Terrors circle around her. Observing, examining, judging.

They dare not wantonly approach her. They smell a familiar scent. They realize that the guitarist in front of them is a hollow vessel. Her distant connection resonates through the depths bestowed to them as their birthright.
Even on land, they instantly feel as if they have become one with the sea.
(Conflicted, confused slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: How... miraculous.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: These creatures are intimately connected with the land itself. In their eyes, are humans and Sea Terrors no different?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Frost does not answer. She is intoxicated by the melody, consumed by the passion.
Kal'tsit knows that the question was rhetorical.
Kal'tsit, was this also part of your plans? For them to sit on the coast, while the Penal Battalion delves into the sea?
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: If you choose to believe so, then yes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But the Penal Battalion didn't even have time to prepare even a single ship for us.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: There's already one sitting along the shore.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's been years since the Gran Faro project was scrapped.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...First we must uproot the evil that still grips this land.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: I remain an Inquisitor. I will not sit idly by and watch the corruption that's been infesting Iberia slip away, right before my eyes.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Woah!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Are you alright?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: L-Let go of me! Don't just go around picking people up!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But, my fragile little bird, how will you climb up this tall deck if I don't carry you?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Th-That's not what I meant— Tch, forget it...
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: What's the matter?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Inquisitor Irene simply stares blankly at the scenery in front of her.
A dim sliver of light in front of the pitch-black sea. In front of the ship's mast, time seems to have stood still for the past sixty years.
So this... is the Stultifera. 'Stultifera Navis.' The Ship of Fools.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: The flagship that housed both scholars and soldiers, the floating palace of a fallen dynasty. It's quite... different from how it's described in the books.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: W-Wait!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: What are you even searching for, on a ship this big?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Breogan was an Ægir.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This key must be hiding some sort of clue that the Ægir wanted to leave behind.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: A key? What is it meant to open?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: That's what I'm here to find out.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Even ignoring its size, the ship's also been lost at sea for sixty years. How do you plan to—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Perhaps you young Iberians haven't had much exposure to these transport vessels. Even with Breogan's help, this thing was so shoddily built.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Why you...!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Were the seas calm on our way here? I'm sure you know the answer.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Then my next question for you is this: 'why didn't this ship sink?'
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You don't mean—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Footsteps. Heavy, viscous footsteps.
A shadow appears upon the deck, where no living beings should stir.
No, Irene immediately reprimands herself for having such a thought. Gladiia's question was also on her mind. Along the shore, in the waters. She's already seen so many of these.
The moment she sees the enemy, the young, talented Inquisitor Irene's first instinct is to hold her breath.
By the time she remembers how to breathe, Gladiia has already stepped forward.
(Screeching howl) —!
Interesting, you managed to dodge it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Not for long.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Don't even think about it!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It hid inside the cabin! Should we chase it?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: ...Yes, that is where it went.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But why would it hide inside? We're out in the middle of the ocean.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: What do we do?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It's not alone. There's more than one Seaborn on this ship. And even more Sea Terrors.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We should split up.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I'll go after it.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I'll head down.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: D-Down? How? Do you people already know the layout of this ship?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: We don't, but that's nothing a sharp blade can't solve.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Excuse me?! This is the most important legacy of the Iberian sages we're talking about here!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: And where will you go, little bird?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I... I have an obligation to supervise you. So I'll go with you.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: There are so many mysteries shrouding the Stultifera. If it's been preserved this well, why did it never try to return to Iberia in the last sixty years?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: As an Inquisitor, I must uncover the truth.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Shall we hold hands then?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Wh-What's the meaning of this?!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: You are a fruit of elegance and grace. But your hard work and natural talents are worthless before the enemies you'll face.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I fear we will lose you with but a momentary lapse of focus.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...You look down on others too much, Ægir.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Keep her safe then.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Will do.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Shark.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Did you remember something?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...The sea breeze told me. It spoke of a sculpture. It is weeping, waiting for me.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Will I be able to find it on this ship?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Of course. But make it quick.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I'll be waiting for you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: What sculpture?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Well, let us say our greetings to the deceased while searching for its whereabouts, Skadi.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...I'm glad you still remember my name.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: This place... really is fit to be a palace.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: But, how is it so pristine? There's not a speck of dust to be found. Look, even the floorboards are sparkling.
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Maybe someone wanted to keep it tidy.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Who though?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Who knows.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You said you were going to pursue that monster. How are you planning on doing that?
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Its scent doesn't lie.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Though this place is full of putrid smells. There must be more—
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: (Laborious slithering sounds)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: Sea Terrors!
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: As expected, they turned this place into a nest.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I'll handle this.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: (Slithers around in place)
attributes.name: Sea Terror

attributes.content: —Wait! Specter! The scent's coming from below!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Ugh—
attributes.name: Inquisitor Irene

attributes.content: Ishar-mla.
Ishar-mla.
Urgh, that impact... Are you alright, Specter?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...Specter? Laurentina!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What are you looking at? A mirror? Why is there a mirror?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...The mirror's been broken.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What's with this place? Why did the Iberians make a transport vessel into a palace?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It's nothing like Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Is there anything special about the mirror?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I saw it.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: At first, there was a speck of light from the surface of the shattered mirror. But it quickly gave way to the dark shadow beneath it. Its eye.
The Seaborn had long been waiting here, sitting alone in its golden hall.
...Ishar-mla, La-tina, Louu-tina, Laren-tina......?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: It's young... No, we can't judge their strength by size. Another Seaborn, without a doubt.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Sea Terrors too! They're gathering, Specter!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Specter ignores her words as she stares blankly at the mirror. And at the Seaborn behind it.
...You remember me?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: The Seaborn nods slightly. It looks at Specter and Skadi with confusion. Thinking.
Why are they different from how they were in 'the past'? What happened to them? How can it help free them from their shackles of flesh and blood?
Specter!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Don't think about it!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I'm not.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Her tone had changed.
Skadi looks at Specter with astonishment. She had never been able to get a definite answer from either Gladiia or Kal'tsit regarding the moment of clarity Specter displayed in Sal Viento.
Laurentina, you...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Laurentina. Yes, Laurentina.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Look, here on the scroll hanging from my weapon. Back when I wrote my name down and hung it here, I could still remember where I was born.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Ahhh... A lucid dream, huh? Really, it's been too long.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Specter.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Mm. We can reminisce later.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Whether in Sal Viento or aboard this familiar-yet-unfamiliar vessel, I really hope that next time I'm awakened, it's by Ægir's resplendent domes instead of you ugly monsters.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Hey, thanks for sitting back and letting me finish. Wait, you weren't seriously about to call us your kin were you? Gross.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Come on. Why don't you take a little nap too?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Sink into the quagmire of consciousness, and relinquish the gift of life.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: —– (Screeches)
attributes.name: Seaborn
